intro: Dissochaeta densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense inflorescences, with small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered closely together. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Dissochaeta densiflora is often found in open woodland and savanna habitats.
